A spacious apartment over the city on three floors and a lot of light! Outstanding view over the city from a 28 sqm roof terrace! For a bohemian lifestyle, with ample living spaces, comfort and exclusivity. Mill Lofts was developed to match the 21st century requirements. Located in Soroksári Road, in District IX, just a few meters away from the Danube banks and within easy reach to the city centre, thanks to the excellent public transport facilities, this stunning building consists of 133 exclusive loft apartments, in 4 staircases, sized between 59-240 sqm, combining the 19th century industrial outlook of the building with the latest facilities and luxury finishing of its completely refurbished interiors. The original building, Gizella Mill, was built in 1860 as a flour mill and later converted to be operated by power. Gizella Mill was running until 1963, enabling now to be converted into a top end residential building, to suit purchasers own layout and design, within Mill Lofts, with up to 5 meters interior heights, 24 hours security service and underground parking area with private storages. The upper floors of Mill Lofts offer splendid views over both, the river and the city. Step outside and you will instantly feel the pulse of the city. Walk along Raday Street, the newest Budapest entertainment area with the New National Theatre and the Arts Centre.

For a bohemian lifestyle, with ample living spaces, comfort and exclusivity. Mill Lofts was developed to match the 21st century requirements. Located in Soroksári Road, in District IX, just a few meters away from the Danube banks and within easy reach to the city centre, thanks to the excellent public transport facilities, this stunning building consists of 133 exclusive loft apartments, in 4 staircases, sized between 59-240 sqm, combining the 19th century industrial outlook of the building with the latest facilities and luxury finishing of its completely refurbished interiors. The original building, Gizella Mill, was built in 1860 as a flour mill and later converted to be operated by power. Gizella Mill was running until 1963, enabling now to be converted into a top end residential building, to suit purchasers own layout and design, within Mill Lofts, with up to 5 meters interior heights, 24 hours security service and underground parking area with private storages. The upper floors of Mill Lofts offer splendid views over both, the river and the city. Step outside and you will instantly feel the pulse of the city. Walk along Raday Street, the newest Budapest entertainment area with the New National Theatre and the Arts Centre.

Offered FOR SALE: sunny, bright renovated 68 m2 floor apartment in the impressive neo-Baroque style building at Kossuth Square. Centrally-located in the prestigious Lipótváros neighborhood (District V) next to the Danube and across from the Hungarian Parliament. The stylish MÁK Palace - Magyar Általános Kőszénbánya Rt. (the Hungarian General Coal Mines Ltd) was built in 1927, upon the plans of Lajos Málnai. The graceful wrought iron façade was created by Decorative Arts master, Jungfer Gyula Ironworks. The spacious and elegant foyer runs into three upward spiral staircases making the building's interior one of the most esteemed and beautiful interiors in Budapest. This beautifully maintained building is registered upon Budapest's registered Cultural Monuments. The cozy Elysée Café Bistro chicly sits just next to the main entrance. The 2008 renovation of the apartment, created three independent rooms (19.17 m2, 14.63 m2, 11.2 m2). Each of the three rooms’ south-facing windows overlooks the quiet courtyard. A break-away, fully-equipped kitchen is near the entry, opposite separate bathroom and toilet. The apartment is centrally heated. Cable television and wifi connections available. The elevator has been recently renovated. The flat is ideally located between the Lánc and Margrit bridges, on the M2 (East-West) line of the Budapest Metro across the square, whilst St. Stephen’s Blvd (Szent István körút) is 500 meters or one stop on the scenic Tram No. 2. Trolleys 70/78 are also easily accessible. The property is equally good as a home or for office use, and an excellent investment. Asking Price: 83 million HUF / 263 000 EU

The apartment is renovated and equipped with gas convector. 13th District (Újlipótváros) Újlipótváros is located a few-minute walk away from the bank of the Danube, in a nice neighborhood with a lot of coffee houses and restaurants. Those who enjoy doing sports or other outdoor activities can easily get to Margaret Island, which provides a wide range of such opportunities. Besides the neighborhood the district is rich in entertainment (theatre, movie theatre, etc.) and shopping opportunities (e.g. West End shopping mall). Metro line no. 2, tram line no. 4 and 6 and trolley-bus line no. 76 have stops here, and there is a tram station as well.
